p:
In the matter of the Petition of Arthur Powell for the writ of Habeas Corpus To the Honorable George Turner Judge of the Fourth Judicial District of the Territory of Washington. Your petitioner Arthur Powell shows hereby to your Honors, that yout petitioner is illegally restrained of his liberty at Cheney in Spokane County in the Territory of Washington by E.F. Whittier Sheriff of said Spokane County. That the cause of said restraint is a within named to the said Sheriff by J.J.L. Paul one of the positions of the peace of said Spokane County. That the said restraint is illegal in this that the said J.J.L. Paul as such Justice issued a warrant for the arrest of your petitioner upon the pretended charge of "Horse Stealing" but your petitioner swears that said warrant does not show an offense against the laws of Washington Territory that on the 30th day of April 1885 your petitioner was arrested upon said warrant take efore sai Justice and then and there by by said Justice examined upon said pretended charge. And your petitioner shows to your Honor that the testimony upon said examination showed that no offense against the laws of the Territory of Washington had been committed, and that there was no probable cause to believe your petitioner to be guilty of any offence, notwithstanding which the said Justice held your petitioner to appear before the Grand Jury of Spokane, Douglas, and Lincoln counties at the next term. The district court to be held at said Cheney, without any evidece authorizing ot authority so to do, and therefore as aforesaid, illegally an wrongfully committed. Your petitoner to the custody of said E.F. Whittier, by whom he is not as aforesaid illegally restrained of his liberty. Petitioner shows to your Honor that at said examination the following named prosecuting wit- nesses were subpoenad on the part of the territory, viz: Newton Gardner Jas G. Murphy Louis Lee E. Murray Wm Martin and John Krenshaw and Barton Thomas and the following named persons were sworn and testified in said examination viz: J.G. Brophy, New- ton Thomas William Martin, Louis Lee Arthur Powell John Krenshaw Newton Gardner. Your petitioner therefore prays that a writ of Heabeas Corpus issue to the said E.F. Whittier com- manding him to produce your petitioner before your Honor that the said witnesses be summoned and examined and that your petitioner be discharged from said restraint, and your petitioner as in duly bound will ever pray Arthur Powell
Territory of Washington County of Spokane} Arthur Powell being first duly sworn on oath doth say that he is the petitioner in the foregoing petition that he had read the said petition knows the content thereof and believes the same to be true. Arthur Powell Aubscribed and sworn to by me this 13th day of May 1885. F.A. bettas Notary Puclic of Washington Territory
